channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Review of Devon and Cornwall Police firearms procedure
item.description: The inquiry into Devon and Cornwall Police follows a mass shooting in Plymouth.

item.title: Woodmancote shootings: Twin's gun law anger after family deaths
item.description: Rob Needham is thought to have killed partner Kelly Fitzgibbons and their daughters, then himself.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: High Court bid to save animal refused
item.description: A last-ditch attempt to halt the animal's destruction is refused at the High Court in London.

item.title: West Mercia Police officer guilty of Worcestershire crash death
item.description: Jamie Holloway was driving at speeds of up to 110mph before he hit David Shaw's car, the trial heard.

item.title: Boy dies falling from Sheffield hotel window
item.description: The boy, aged under 10, fell from the OYO Sheffield Metropolitan Hotel, police say.

item.title: Bradford mother jailed after 'home alone' son killed by car
item.description: Wendy Hall left her seven-year-old son at their home in Bradford while she visited her partner.

item.title: Council hires security to guard Banksy-style Harwich mural
item.description: A council which was criticised for painting over a Banksy artwork has been quick to protect a new mural.

item.title: Who were the victims?
item.description: The gunman's mother, Maxine Davison, and three-year-old Sophie Martyn have been named among the dead.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Church service for victims
item.description: The service remembers five people killed in a mass shooting in the Keyham area of the city.

item.title: Fireworks competition dedicated to Plymouth shooting victims
item.description: Bosses say they "thought long and hard" about holding the British Firework Championships.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: 'Your memories will never leave us' - notes to the victims
item.description: Flowers and heartfelt messages are placed in Keyham in memory of the five people killed.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Minute's silence is held for shooting victims
item.description: Five people were killed in the shooting on Thursday before Jake Davison took his own life.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: PM Boris Johnson - My thoughts are with the families
item.description: Boris Johnson also says it needs to be "properly investigated" how the gunman got a firearms licence.

item.title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
item.description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

item.title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

item.title: A visual guide to what happened
item.description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Eileen Barrott murder: Husband traced to Elgin
item.description: Mark Barrott is wanted by police in connection with his wife's death in Leeds at the weekend.

item.title: Stratford death: Woman falls from building after man arrested
item.description: The Met informed the police watchdog as an arrest was made one hour earlier in the same building.

item.title: Gurkha back at Downing Street hunger strike after being taken ill
item.description: Former Gurkha soldier Dhan Gurung returns to a protest over pensions after a health scare.

item.title: Austin Mitchell: Former Great Grimsby MP dies aged 86
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer leads tributes, saying Mr Mitchell served "with remarkable commitment".

item.title: Dog stolen from kennels six months ago found during police raid
item.description: Rummy, one of eight dogs stolen from a kennels in Derbyshire, is found in Leicestershire.

item.title: Plasma donor meets children helped by donations
item.description: A donor from Coventry meets a family from Nottingham whose children who were saved by plasma.

item.title: Pub car park 'rifle' arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: West Midlands boxers reflect on Olympic Games
item.description: The three boxers from the West Midlands have fond memories of their time in Tokyo and medal wins.

item.title: Covid: 'I'm pregnant, should I have the vaccine?'
item.description: Many pregnant women have declined the Covid jab, but what's best for the baby?

item.title: Portrait artist captures Southampton's homeless community
item.description: Artist James Earley uses his work to raise awareness of homelessness and money for charity.

item.title: England v India: Hosts recall Dawid Malan, drop Dom Sibley and Zak Crawley for third Test
item.description: Yorkshire batsman Dawid Malan recalled to the England squad for the third Test against India, with Dom Sibley and Zak Crawley both dropped from the 15-man squad.

item.title: Pacos de Ferreira v Tottenham Hotspur: Harry Kane to miss Europa Conference League tie
item.description: Harry Kane will not play for Tottenham in Thursday's Europa Conference League play-off first leg against Pacos de Ferreira.

item.title: The Hundred: London Spirit beat Welsh Fire but miss out on top-three finish
item.description: London Spirit beat Welsh Fire in the final group game of the women's Hundred in Cardiff, but miss out on reaching the latter stages of the competition.

item.title: Blackpool v Coventry City: Sky Blues confirm police investigation into racist abuse of player
item.description: Coventry City confirm a police investigation into an allegation of racist abuse aimed at a Sky Blues player in Tuesday's win at Blackpool.
